itemListElement.name: Gluten free Yeast free Vegan Pizza Crust Recipe

@graph.name: Gluten free Yeast free Vegan Pizza Crust Recipe
@graph.description: Easy Gluten free Yeast free Vegan Pizza Crust Recipe. How to make the best yeast-free gluten-free crust with just 4 main ingredients. Gum-free Soy-free Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 cup chickpea flour (flour of white garbanzo beans)
2 Tbsp brown rice flour  (or white rice flour)
1 Tbsp coconut flour (or use more chickpea flour)
tofu thyme basil ricotta (use less thyme and add some basil, or use vegan cheese or choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Roast the chickpea flour in a large skillet over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Stir once every minute for the first 2 minutes. Then every 20 seconds. Cool and transfer to a bowl. Roasted flour gives a better flavor profile. You can skip the roasting and use the chickpea flour as is in the batter..
recipeInstructions.name: Roast the chickpea flour in a large skillet over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Stir once every minute for the first 2 minutes. Then every 20 seconds. Cool and transfer to a bowl. Roasted flour gives a better flavor profile. You can skip the roasting and use the chickpea flour as is in the batter..

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rest of the dry ingredients to the chickpea flour bowl and whisk well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the rest of the dry ingredients to the chickpea flour bowl and whisk well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add lemon juice to 3/4 cup water and add to the bowl. Add oil and mix or whisk until there are no lumps. Add 1 to 2 tbsps more water and mix in to make a thick batter. Let the mixture sit for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add lemon juice to 3/4 cup water and add to the bowl. Add oil and mix or whisk until there are no lumps. Add 1 to 2 tbsps more water and mix in to make a thick batter. Let the mixture sit for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: If the batter is too thick/stiff, add 1 to 2 tsp more water and mix in. Drop the thick batter on parchment lined baking sheet. Spray water on the batter. Use a large spoon or spatula to spread it into a circle. Spray water on the batter to avoid sticking to the spatula while spreading.
recipeInstructions.name: If the batter is too thick/stiff, add 1 to 2 tsp more water and mix in. Drop the thick batter on parchment lined baking sheet. Spray water on the batter. Use a large spoon or spatula to spread it into a circle. Spray water on the batter to avoid sticking to the spatula while spreading.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the crust for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and top with sauce, veggies, cheese of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the crust for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and top with sauce, veggies, cheese of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake again for 12 to 14 minutes. Broil for a minute to crisp or melt the cheese if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake again for 12 to 14 minutes. Broil for a minute to crisp or melt the cheese if needed.
